newsitem.title: PERU: Fearing loud bangs, Peru police ban fireworks.
newsitem.headline: Fearing loud bangs, Peru police ban fireworks.

text.p: Radio and television on Tuesday broadcast pleas by police to Lima residents not to set off Christmas fireworks to avoid alarming rebels holding about 140 hostages.

The broadcast said firework explosions could be mistaken for bombs or gunfire and ran the risk of provoking about 20 heavily armed Marxist guerrillas holed up in the Japanese embassy residence since Dec. 17.
As in most Latin American countries, Peruvians traditionally set off noisy fireworks at around midnight on Christmas Eve to mark the beginning of the Yuletide holiday.
